Title: Triangle inequality for subtraction?
AcceptedAnswer:
It's sometimes called the reverse triangle inequality. The proper form is
$$\left| a - b \right| \ge \big||a| - |b|\big|$$
For the proof, consider
$$|a| = |a - b + b| \le |a - b| + |b|$$
$$|b| = |b - a + a| \le |a - b| + |a|$$
so that we have
$$-|a-b|\le|a|-|b| \le |a - b|$$
